comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: The handwritten inscription reads, "OLD COURT HOUSE BATHURST ERECTED BETWEEN 1830-40 DEMOLISHED 1875 TO PROVIDE FOR ERECTION OF COURT HOUSE POST AND TELEGRAPH OFFICES. W.H.K.R. '44 " According to a photograph of the old Court House from the Holtermann photographic collection in the SLNSW, the Bathurst Gaol is behind this court house building: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=63402# The old Bathurst Gaol was itself also demolished in the 1880s: www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4403060938/
